epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern exceeding 0.1%
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation when physical not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

installation.operational_control: No operational control by Holcim; assumptions based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from ready-mix truck and pump; manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

assumptions.deconstruction_process: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete (carbonation) not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

impact_categories: Abiotic depletion potential (elements and fossil fuels)
Use of renewable and non-renewable primary energy
Use of secondary materials and fuels
Materials for recycling and energy recovery
disclaimers: Some impact indicators have high uncertainty or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing

contact_information.disclaimer: This publication provides general information only and is no substitute for professional technical engineering advice. Users must make their own determination as to the suitability of this information or any Holcim product for their specific circumstances. Holcim accepts no liability for any loss or damage resulting from their specific circumstances or reliance on the information provided.
